intro: Fimbristylis leucostachya, commonly known as the white-stemmed flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and Australia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. This species typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments, where it forms dense, low-growing clumps. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its inflorescence consists of a single, elongated spikelet that bears small, white flowers. Fimbristylis leucostachya plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
